Returns: the result of executing command or null.
Parameters: Object: the command object for the JIT compiler.
command(java.lang.Object).Description: Executes an operation according to the specified command object. This method is the low-level interface to the JIT compiler. It may return any object or null if no JIT compiler is available. Returns null on Android, whether or not the system has a JIT.

disable().Description: Disables the JIT compiler. Does nothing on Android.

Returns: true if the compilation has been successful; false if it has failed or if there is no JIT compiler available.
Parameters: String: the string to match class names with.
compileClasses(java.lang.String).Description: Compiles all classes whose name matches the specified name using the JIT compiler and indicates if compilation has been successful. Does nothing and returns false on Android.

enable().Description: Enables the JIT compiler. Does nothing on Android.

Returns: true if the compilation has been successful; false if it has failed or if there is no JIT compiler available.
Parameters: Class: java.lang.Class the class to JIT compile
compileClass(java.lang.Class<?>).Description: Compiles the specified class using the JIT compiler and indicates if compilation has been successful. Does nothing and returns false on Android.
